Study on spectral lag and flare characters based on GRB051117A
CHANG Xue-zhao,PENG Zhao-yang,WANG Dao-zhou, CHEN Jia-ming (College of Physics and Electronic Information,Yunnan Normal University,Kunming65oo92,China)

Abstract: Marguti et al. found a strong correlation between the spectral lag of flare and its characteristic parameters (peak time,width, rise time,and decay time) in 8 GRBs,and as time goes onï¼Œ the flare becomes wider and the spectral lag becomes larger. We use the discrete-correlation function (DCF) to study the spectral lag of a multi-flare GRB (GRB051117A ) with 10 flares,it is found that within GRBO51117A,the spectral lag is also strongly correlated with thepeak timeï¼Œ widthï¼Œ risetime and decaytime ofthe flares. thisis, $l a g \propto t _ { p e a k }$ ï¼Œ $\omega$ ï¼Œ $t _ { r i s e }$ ã€tdecay. The flares willalso evolve over time within a GRB. This work extends the relationship between the spectral lag between GRBs and the characteristic parameters of flares to the interior of GRBs,which can help us have a deeper understanding of multi-flare GRBs. Moreover, the correlation between the flare characteristic parameters within GRB051117A is highly similar to that between multiple GRBs and even prompt emission pulses. This also supports that X-ray flares and prompt emission pulses may have the same physical origin.
Key words: GRBs; X-ray flare; DCF; spectral lag
